sentence: Two gay men were having a few drinks one said bottoms up! the other got topsy.
explanation: Refers to being in a state of disarray or confusion and can also refer to someone being tipsy or drunk.
first_new_sentence: The house was all topsy after the kids had a party.
second_new_sentence: After a few drinks, he felt rather topsy at the bar.

sentence: What do you call an academic who apologises all the time? an anthropologist
explanation: Refers to a person who studies humanity and can also imply a person who studies social interactions and may apologize often.
first_new_sentence: The anthropologist presented his research on ancient cultures.
second_new_sentence: In social settings, he tends to be the anthropologist, constantly assessing the dynamics of the group.

sentence: What do you call a party with 100 midgets? a little get together.
explanation: Refers to size and can also mean not serious or insignificant.
first_new_sentence: The little dog played joyfully in the yard.
second_new_sentence: He made a little progress in understanding the complex topic.
